Even getting out of this place was a struggle as the waiter did not give us our check several times after asking if we were through eating. Staff were  impolite to one another, but friendly to guests; still I don't want to hear staff bickering during my meal. The chips were warm and the salsa tased good. My margarita was not bad either, the best part of the entire experience. The waiter clearly sensed disappointment and gave a discounted meal.  Overall, Pedro's you have some extreme fixing to do.

Pedro's used to be a 5-star for us - back when they were on the West side.  The East location has never been as good, and it seems to be slipping. 

In all, the food was good.  Considering we were there at 3pm on a Saturday, and were mostly alone, you would think the food would have been piping hot when served.  It wasn't.  Granted, it wasn't cold either, but just not that "fresh out of the oven" kind of hot you would expect when there's nobody else there.  It tasted fine, and the chips and salsa were a trip down memory lane.

Service was excellent.  Brooks was on top of things.  Being his only table probably made that easy, but he was super nice and willing to get us anything we needed asap.  

The restaurant itself is aging.  A little work could be put into it to make it nice again.  There were more flies around than I prefer to have - that was a turn-off.

On two different occasions I have found dirty glasses on my table.  Last night there was a water glass turned upside down but with lipstick all around the rim.  The other time I had THREE GLASSES brought to me with stuff stuck at the bottom or floating in my water, 3 times...  That means, not once,  not twice but THREE times my server brought me a dirty glass...  You would think that at after the first glass that had crap floating in it he would be more thorough and check the next TWO..  No. Horrible experience. Manager came over and was like "what would you like me to do" ummm your the manager not me..  It was ridiculous.  I really enjoy Pedro's but it's becoming harder and harder to get myself to go,  my boyfriend hates it and only goes because I am trying to give it chances..  But come on.  Get your crap together

Food is ok. Fajitas were pretty good. Enchiladas left much to be desired. Service is ok, kind of slow especially if you have 8 or more people. Table is served the standard chips and salsa. Also served fresh tortillas and butter which I have never seen anywhere else and were very good.

Not bad.  They had a great Valentine's Day special that we went here for, and the service was prompt and we got our food quickly.  Our waiter was friendly (they have been whenever I've gone) and the food was pretty tasty.  All in all, not much to separate Pedro's from the other Mexican restaurants in the area, and it certainly isn't the best out there, but decent in price, quality and service for sure (the Seafood Suiza is the best there, in my honest opinion, but all other foods are just ok).

Pedro's is one of my families favorite Mexican restaurants. The service is usually hit or miss depending on the time of day and any events going on (game days, holidays etc). We usually wait about 10-15 minutes for a table but there is a large waiting area and bar. Meals come with complimentary chips, salsa and tortillas. All of which are delicious. My go-to on the menu is a chicken chimichanga with chicken sauce. The rest of my family usually orders differing flavors of chimichangas or fajitas. The best item on their menu is their delicious corn cakes- I usually get two of them as my 2 sides with my chimichanga. I like to convince myself they're somewhat healthy because theres corn in them right?

Opinions are a changing.  Went to Pedros over the weekend.  Tamales were not good.  The sauce had formed a skin on the top because it sat under the heat lamps too long.  I took three bites before I found any pork.  I ate half of one and the waiter asked if I wanted to take the rest home.  When I said no, my satisfaction was not questioned.  I'll stick with Laredos.

I hate giving Pedro's 2.5 stars since it has always been my favorite restaurant growing up. But after visiting for a recent badger game, I found myself pretty underwhelmed  while the margs are cheap & our waiter was great, I gotta give the food a harsh 2.5(?) stars. Maybe I just didn't order the right thing (I used to get the veggie fajitas all the time so perhaps I should've stuck with em), but still I ordered a taco salad and it was kinda tiny for being $9. It only seemed like it had a few bites of lettuce to it, some beans, and some cheese on top. I think I ate it in 2 minutes flat (this may be due to the fact that I am a food inhaler, but still). My mom also got the "game day special" chicken quesadilla for $3-4, and was definitely not stoked when they brought her some pita-like bread (that definitely looked like it had been defrosted that morning) filled with some wimpy pieces of chicken and the saddest amount of cheese I've ever seen on a quesadilla. Yes, it's a $3 special, but a quesadilla needs some cheese ya know? ? ? So overall, it just wasn't what we were expecting from the restaurant we grew up loving. That being said, I hope our next visit is a lil more similar to the Pedro's I adored in 7th grade (bring back the old queso please). But if you do happen to be looking for some Americanized Mexican food that is cheap and usually tastes alright, I'd probably give this place a shot. Maybe just don't order the game day specials or the taco salads.

Another fantastic spread was provided to my office again today! Pedro's catering is such a great service, and I definitely still recommend them!! 

I just wanted to update my review and add a few photos. The service was yet again stellar. Everyone in my office was happy with full bellies, and I know for sure we will order catering again from Pedro's in the future. 

SO YUMMY!
Their lunch specials are always quick and delicious. Reasonable price for lunch and you can get your appetitie going with chips and salsa.

Pedros is a staple in the community.  A great place where you can bring family and friends to have a really good time.  The food is all made fresh, which is great.  For the price and the selection, you really can't beat it.

One other thing to mention...  Have had a group event at Pedro's - and also a couple events catered.  The catering menu is great - and they make it really easy.
